verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:397
verses.text: Fights, but not conquers.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:398
verses.text: Wherefore? Because we are strong, or because He is strong in us who in the hands of the persecutors was found weak? He hath made us strong, who resisted not His persecutors.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:399
verses.text: "For He was crucified of weakness, but He liveth by the power of God".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:401
verses.text: "I write unto you, children".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:402
verses.text: Whence children? "Because ye have known the Father.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:403
verses.text: I write unto you fathers:" he enforceth this, and repeateth, "Because ye have known Him that is from the beginning".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:404
verses.text: Remember that ye are fathers: if ye forget "Him that is from the beginning," ye have lost your fatherhood.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:405
verses.text: "I write unto you, young men".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:406
verses.text: Again and again consider that ye are young men: fight, that ye may overcome: overcome, that ye may be crowned: be lowly, that ye fall not in the fight.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:407
verses.text: "I write unto you, young men, because ye are strong, and the word of God abideth in you, and ye have overcome the wicked one".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:409
verses.text: All these things, my brethren,â€”"because we have known That which is from the beginning, because we are strong, because we have known the Father,"â€”do all these, while they in a manner commend knowledge, not commend charity? If we have known, let us love: for knowledge without charity saveth not.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:410
verses.text: "Knowledge puffeth up, charity edifieth".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:411
verses.text: If ye have a mind to confess and not love, ye begin to be like the demons.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:412
verses.text: The demons confessed the Son of God, and said, "What have we to do with Thee?" and were repulsed.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:413
verses.text: Confess and embrace.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:414
verses.text: For those feared for their iniquities; love ye Him that forgiveth your iniquities.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:415
verses.text: But how can we love God, if we love the world? He prepareth us therefore to be inhabited by charity.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:416
verses.text: There are two loves: of the world, and of God: if the love of the world inhabit, there is no way for the love of God to enter in: let the love of the world make way, and the love of God inhabit; let the better have place.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:417
verses.text: Thou lovedst the world: love not the world: when thou hast emptied thine heart of earthly love, thou shalt drink in love Divine: and thenceforth beginneth charity to inhabit thee, from which can nothing of evil proceed.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:418
verses.text: Hear ye therefore his words, how he goes to work in the manner of one that makes a clearance.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:419
verses.text: He comes upon the hearts of men as a field that he would occupy: but in what state does he find it? If he finds a wood, he roots it up; if he finds the field cleared, he plants it.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:420
verses.text: He would plant a tree there, charity.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:421
verses.text: And what is the wood he would root up? Love of the world.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:422
verses.text: Hear him, the rooter up of the wood! "Love not the world," (for this comes next,) "neither the things that are in the world; if any man love the world, the love of the Father is not in him".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:424
verses.text: Ye have heard that "if any man love the world, the love of the Father is not in him".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:425
verses.text: Let not any say in his heart that this is false, brethren: God saith it; by the Apostle the Holy Ghost hath spoken; nothing more true: "If any man love the world, the love of the Father is not in him".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:426
verses.text: Wouldest thou have the Father's love, that thou mayest be joint-heir with the Son? Love not the world.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:427
verses.text: Shut out the evil love of the world, that thou mayest be filled with  the love of God.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:428
verses.text: Thou art a vessel; but as yet thou art full.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:429
verses.text: Pour out what thou hast, that thou mayest receive what thou hast not.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:430
verses.text: Certainly, our brethren are now born again of water and of the Spirit: we also some years ago were born again of water and of the Spirit.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:431
verses.text: Good is it for us that we love not the world, lest the sacraments remain in us unto damnation, not as means of strengthening unto salvation.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:432
verses.text: That which strengthens unto salvation is, to have the root of charity, to have the "power of godliness," not "the form" only.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:433
verses.text: Good is the form, holy the form: but what avails the form, if it hold not the root? The branch that is cut off, is it not cast into the fire? Have the form, but in the root.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:434
verses.text: But in what way are ye rooted so that ye be not rooted up? By holding charity, as saith the Apostle Paul, "rooted and grounded in charity".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:435
verses.text: How shall charity be rooted there, amid the overgrown wilderness of the love of the world? Make clear riddance of the woods.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:436
verses.text: A mighty seed ye are about to put in: let there not be that in the field which shall choke the seed.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:437
verses.text: These are the uprooting words which he hath said: "Love not the world, neither the things that  are in the world.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:438
verses.text: If any man love the world, the love of the Father is not in him".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:440
verses.text: "For all that is in the world, is the lust of the flesh, and the lust of the eyes, and the pride of life," three things he hath said, which are not of the Father, but are of the world.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:441
verses.text: And the world passeth away, and the lust thereof: but he that doeth the will of God abideth for ever, even as He abideth for ever".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:442
verses.text: Why am I not to love what God made? What wilt thou? Whether wilt thou love the things of time, and pass away with time; or not love the world, and live to eternity with God? The river of temporal things hurries one along: but like a tree sprung up beside the river is our Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:443
verses.text: He assumed flesh, died, rose again, ascended into heaven.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:444
verses.text: It was His will to plant Himself, in a manner, beside the river of the things of time.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:445
verses.text: Art thou rushing down the stream to the headlong deep? Hold fast the tree.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:446
verses.text: Is love of the world whirling thee on? Hold fast Christ.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:447
verses.text: For thee He became temporal, that thou mightest become eternal; because He also in such sort became temporal, that He remained still eternal.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:448
verses.text: Something was added to Him from time, not anything went from His eternity.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:449
verses.text: But thou wast born temporal, and by sin wast made temporal: thou wast made temporal by sin, He was made temporal by mercy in remitting sins.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:450
verses.text: How great the difference, when two are in a prison, between the criminal and him that visits him! For upon a time a person comes to his friend and enters in to visit him, and both seem to be in prison; but they differ by a wide distinction.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:451
verses.text: The one, his cause presses down: the other, humanity has brought thither.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:452
verses.text: So in this our mortal state, we were held fast by our guiltiness, He in mercy came down: He entered in unto the captive, a Redeemer not an oppressor.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:453
verses.text: The Lord for us shed His blood, redeemed us, changed our hope.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:454
verses.text: As yet we bear the mortality of the flesh, and take the future immortality upon trust: and on the sea we are tossed by the waves, but we have the anchor of hope already fixed upon the land.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:456
verses.text: But let us "not love the world, neither the things that are in the world.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:457
verses.text: For the things that are in the world, are the lust of the flesh, and the lust of the eyes, and the pride of life".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:458
verses.text: These three are they: lest haply any man say, "The things that are in the world, God made: i-e: heaven and earth, the sea: the sun, the moon, the stars, all the garniture of the heavens.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:459
verses.text: What is the garniture of the sea? all creeping things.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:460
verses.text: What of the earth? animals, trees, flying creatures.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:461
verses.text: These are 'in the world,' God made them.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:462
verses.text: Why then am I not to love what God hath made?" Let the Spirit of God be in thee, that thou mayest see that all these things are good: but woe to thee if thou love the things made, and forsake the Maker of them! Fair are they to thee: but how much fairer He that formed them! Mark well, beloved.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:463
verses.text: For by similitudes ye may be instructed: lest Satan steal upon you, saying what he is wont to say, Take your enjoyment in the creature of God; wherefore made He those things but for your enjoyment? And men drink themselves drunken, and perish, and forget their own Creator: while not temperately but lustfully they use the things created, the Creator is despised.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:464
verses.text: Of such saith the apostle: "They worshipped and served the creature rather than the Creator, Who is blessed for ever".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:465
verses.text: God doth not forbid thee to love these things, howbeit, not to set thine affections upon them for blessedness, but to approve and praise them to this end, that thou mayest love thy Creator.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:466
verses.text: In the same manner, my brethren, as if a bridegroom should make a ring for his bride, and she having received the ring, should love it more than she loves the bridegroom who made the ring for her: would not her soul be found guilty of adultery in the very gift of the bridegroom, albeit she did but love what the bridegroom gave her? By all means let her love what the bridegroom gave: yet should she say, "This ring is enough for me, I do not wish to see his face now:" what sort of woman would she be? Who would not detest such folly? who not pronounce her guilty of an adulterous mind? Thou lovest gold in place of the man, lovest a ring in place of the bridegroom: if this be in thee, that thou lovest a ring in place of thy bridegroom, and hast no wish to see thy bridegroom; that he has given thee an earnest, serves not to pledge thee to him, but to turn away thy heart from him! For this the bridegroom gives earnest, that in his earnest he may himself be loved.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:467
verses.text: Well then, God gave thee all these things: love Him that made them.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:468
verses.text: There is more that He would fain give thee, that is, His very Self that made these things.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:469
verses.text: But if thou love theseâ€”what though God made themâ€”and neglect the Creator and love the world; shall not thy love be accounted adulterous?  12.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:470
verses.text: For "the world" is the appellation given not only to this fabric which God made heaven and earth, the sea, things visible and invisible: but the inhabitants of the world are called the world, just as we call a "house" both the walls and them that inhabit therein.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:471
verses.text: And sometimes we praise a house, and find fault with the inhabitants.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:472
verses.text: For we say, A good house; because it is marbled and beautifully ceiled: and in another sense we say, A good house: no man there suffers wrong, no acts of plunder, no acts of oppression, are done there.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:473
verses.text: Now we praise not the building, but those who dwell within the building: yet we call it "house," both this and that.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:474
verses.text: For all lovers of the world, because by love they inhabit the world, just as those inhabit heaven, whose heart is on high while in the flesh they walk on earth: I say then, all lovers of the world are called the world.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:475
verses.text: The same have only these three things, "lust of the flesh, lust of the eyes, vain glory of life".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:476
verses.text: For they lust to eat, drink, cohabit: to use these pleasures.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:477
verses.text: Not surely, that there is no allowed measure in these things, or that when it is said, Love not these things, it means that ye are not to eat, or not to drink, or not to beget children? This is not the thing said.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:478
verses.text: Only, let there be measure, because of the Creator, that these things may not bind you by your loving of them: lest ye love that for enjoyment, which ye ought to have for use.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:479
verses.text: But ye are not put to the proof except when two things are propounded to you, this or that: Will thou righteousness or gains? I have not wherewithal to live, have not wherewithal to eat, have not wherewithal to drink.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:480
verses.text: But what if thou canst not have these but by iniquity? Is it not better to love that which thou losest not, than to lose thyself by iniquity? Thou seest the gain of gold, the loss of faith thou seest not.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:481
verses.text: This then, saith he to us, is "the lust of the flesh," i-e: the lusting after those things which pertain to the flesh, such as food, and carnal cohabitation, and all other such like.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:483
verses.text: "And the lust of the eyes:" by "the lust of the eyes," he means all curiosity.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:484
verses.text: Now how wide is the scope of curiosity! This it is that works in spectacles, in theatres, in sacraments of the devil, in magical arts, in dealings with darkness: none other than curiosity.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:485
verses.text: Sometimes it tempts even the servants of God, so that they wish as it were to work a miracle, to tempt God whether He will hear their prayers in working of miracles; it is curiosity: this is "lust of the eyes;" it "is not of the Father".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:486
verses.text: If God hath given the power, do the miracle, for He hath put it in thy way to do it: for think not that those who have not done miracles shall not pertain to the kingdom of God.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:487
verses.text: When the apostles were rejoicing that the demons were subject to them, what said the Lord to them? "Rejoice not in this, but rejoice because your names are written in heaven".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:488
verses.text: In that would He have the apostles to rejoice, wherein thou also rejoicest.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:489
verses.text: Woe to thee truly if thy name be not written in heaven! Is it woe to thee if thou raise not the dead? is it woe to thee if thou walk not on the sea? is it woe to thee if thou cast not out demons? If thou hast received power to do them, use it humbly, not proudly.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:490
verses.text: For even of certain false prophets the Lord hath said that "they shall do signs and prodigies".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:491
verses.text: Therefore let there be no "ambition of the world:" Ambitio saeculi, is Pride.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:492
verses.text: The man wishes to make much of himself in his honors: he thinks himself great, whether because of riches, or because of some power.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:494
verses.text: These three there are, and thou canst find nothing whereby human cupidity can be tempted, but either by the lust of the flesh, or the lust of the eyes, or the pride of life.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:495
verses.text: By these three was the Lord tempted of the devil.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:496
verses.text: By the lust of the flesh He was tempted when it was said to Him, "If thou be the Son of God, speak to these stones that they become bread," when He hungered after His fast.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:497
verses.text: But in what way repelled He the tempter, and taught his soldier how to fight? Mark what He said to him: "Not by bread alone doth man live, but by every word of God".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:498
verses.text: He was tempted also by the lust of the eyes concerning a miracle, when he said to Him, "Cast thyself down: for it is written, He shall give his angels charge concerning thee: and in their hands they shall bear thee up, lest at any time thou dash thy foot against a stone".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:499
verses.text: He resisted the tempter, for to do the miracle, would only have been to seem either to have yielded, or to have done it from curiosity; for He wrought when He would, as God, howbeit as healing the weak.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:500
verses.text: For if He had done it then, He might have been thought to wish only to do a miracle.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:501
verses.text: But lest men should think this, mark what He answered; and when the like temptation shall happen to thee, say thou also the same: "Get thee behind me, Satan; for it is written, Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God:" that is, if I do this I shall tempt God.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:502
verses.text: He said what He would have thee to say.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:503
verses.text: When the enemy suggests to thee, "What sort of man, what sort of Christian, art thou? As yet hast thou done one miracle, or by thy prayers have the dead been raised, or hast thou healed the fevered? if thou wert truly of any moment, thou wouldest do some miracle:" answer and say: "It is written, Thou shalt not tempt the Lord thy God:" therefore I will not tempt God, as if I should belong to God if I do a miracle, and not belong if I do none: and what becomes then of His words, "Rejoice, because your names are written in heaven"? By "pride of life" how was the Lord tempted? When he carried Him up to an high place, and said to Him, "All these will I give thee, if thou wilt fall down and worship me".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:504
verses.text: By the loftiness of an earthly kingdom he wished to tempt the King of all worlds: but the Lord who made heaven and earth trod the devil under foot.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:505
verses.text: What great matter for the devil to be conquered by the Lord? Then what did He in the answer He made to the devil but teach thee the answer He would have thee to make? "It is, written, Thou shalt worship the Lord thy God, and Him only shalt thou serve".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:506
verses.text: Holding these things fast, ye shall not have the concupiscence of the world: by not having concupiscence of the world, neither shall the lust of the flesh, nor the lust of the eyes, nor the pride of life, subjugate you: and ye shall make place for Charity when she cometh, that ye may love God.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:507
verses.text: Because if love of the world be there, love of God will not be there.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:508
verses.text: Hold fast rather the love of God, that as God is for ever and ever, so ye also may remain for ever and ever: because such is each one as is his love.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:509
verses.text: Lovest thou earth, thou shalt be earth.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:510
verses.text: Lovest thou God, what shall I say? thou shalt be a god? I darenot say it of myself, let us hear the Scriptures: "I have said, Ye are gods, and all of you sons of the Most High".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:511
verses.text: If then ye would be gods and sons of the Most High, "Love not the world, neither the things that are in the world.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:512
verses.text: If any man love the world, the love of the Father is not in him.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:513
verses.text: For all the things that are in the world, is the lust of the flesh, and the lust of the eyes, and the pride of life, which is not of the Father, but is of the world:" i-e: of men, lovers of the world.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:514
verses.text: "And the world passeth away, and the lusts thereof: but he that doeth the will of God abideth for ever, even as God also abideth for ever".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:515
verses.text: Homily III.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:516
verses.text: 1 John II.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:517
verses.text: 18â€“27  "Children, it is the last hour: and as ye have heard that antichrist shall come, even now are there many antichrists; whereby we know that it is the last hour.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:518
verses.text: They went out from us, but they were not of us: if they had been of us, they would no doubt have continued with us: but they went out, that they might be made manifest that they were not all of us.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:519
verses.text: But ye have an unction from the Holy One, and know all things.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:520
verses.text: I write unto you, not because ye know not the truth, but because ye know it, and that no lie is of the truth.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:521
verses.text: Who is a liar but he that denieth that Jesus is the Christ? [He is antichrist, that denieth the Father and the Son.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:522
verses.text: ] Whosoever denieth the Son, the same hath neither the Father nor the Son: and he that acknowledgeth the Son hath both the Father and the Son.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:523
verses.text: Let that therefore abide in you, which ye have heard from the beginning.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:524
verses.text: If that which ye have heard from the beginning shall remain in you, ye also shall continue in the Son, and in the Father.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:525
verses.text: And this is the promise that He hath promised us, even eternal life.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:526
verses.text: These things have I written unto you concerning them that seduce you; that ye may know that ye have an unction, and that the unction which ye have received of him may abide in you.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:527
verses.text: And ye need not that any man teach you; because His unction teacheth you of all things".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:529
verses.text: "Children, it is the last hour".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:530
verses.text: In this lesson he addresses the children that they may make haste to grow, because "it is the last hour".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:531
verses.text: Age or stature of the body is not at one's own will.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:532
verses.text: A man does not grow in respect of the flesh when he will, any more than he is born when he will: but where the being born rests with the will, the growth also rests with the will.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:533
verses.text: No man is "born of water and the Spirit," except he be willing.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:534
verses.text: Consequently if he will, he grows or makes increase: if he will, he decreases.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:535
verses.text: What is it to grow? To go onward by proficiency.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:536
verses.text: What is it to decrease? To go backward by deficiency.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:537
verses.text: Whoso knows that he is born, let him hear that he is an infant; let him eagerly cling to the breasts of his mother, and he grows apace.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:538
verses.text: Now his mother is the Church; and her breasts are the two Testaments of the Divine Scriptures.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:539
verses.text: Hence let him suck the milk of all the things that as signs of spiritual truths were done in time for our eternal salvation, that being nourished and strengthened, he may attain to the eating of solid meat, which is, "In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:540
verses.text: Our milk is Christ in His humility; our meat, the selfsame Christ equal with the Father.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:541
verses.text: With milk He nourisheth thee, that He may feed thee with bread: for with the heart spiritually to touch Christ is to know that He is equal with the Father.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:543
verses.text: Therefore it was that He forbade Mary to touch Him, and said to her, "Touch me not; for I am not yet ascended unto the Father".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:544
verses.text: What is this? He gave Himself to be handled by the disciples, and did He shun Mary's touch? Is not He the same that said to the doubting disciple, "Reach hither thy fingers, and feel the scars"? Was He at that time ascended to the Father? Then why doth He forbid Mary, and saith, "Touch me not; for I am not yet ascended to the Father?" Or are we to say, that He feared not to be touched by men, and feared to be touched by women? The touch of Him cleanseth all flesh.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:545
verses.text: To whom He willed first to be manifested, by them feared He to be handled? Was not His resurrection announced by women to the men, that so the serpent should by a sort of counterplot be overcome? For because he first by the woman announced death to man, therefore to men was also life announced by a woman.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:546
verses.text: Then why was He unwilling to be touched, but because He would have it to be understood of that spiritual touch? The spiritual touch takes place from a pure heart.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:547
verses.text: That person does of a pure heart reach Christ with his touch who understands Him coequal with the Father.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:548
verses.text: But whoso does not yet understand Christ's Godhead, that person reaches but unto the flesh, reaches not unto the Godhead.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:549
verses.text: Now what great matter is it, to reach only unto that which the persecutors reached unto, who crucified Him? But that is the great thing, to understand the Word God with God, in the beginning, by whom all things were made: such as He would have Himself to be known when He said to Philip, "Am I so long time with you, and have ye not known me, Philip? He that seeth me, seeth also the Father".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:551
verses.text: But lest any be sluggish to go forward, let him hear: "Children, it is the last hour".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:552
verses.text: Go forward, run, grow; "it is the last hour".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:553
verses.text: This same last hour is long; yet it is the last.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:554
verses.text: For he has put "hour" for "the last time;" because it is in the last times that our Lord Jesus Christ is to come.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:555
verses.text: But some will say, How the last times? how the last hour? Certainly antichrist will first come, and then will come the day of judgment.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:556
verses.text: John perceived these thoughts: lest people should in a manner become secure, and think it was not the last hour because antichrist was to come, he said to them, "And as ye have heard that antichrist is to come, now are there come many antichrists".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:557
verses.text: Could it have many antichrists, except it were "the last hour"?  4.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:558
verses.text: Whom has he called antichrists? He goes on and expounds.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:559
verses.text: "Whereby we know that it is the last hour".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:560
verses.text: By what? Because "many antichrists are come.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:561
verses.text: They went out from us;" see the antichrists! "They went out from us:" therefore we bewail the loss.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:562
verses.text: Hear the consolation.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:563
verses.text: "But they were not of us".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:564
verses.text: All heretics, all schismatics went out from us, that is, they go out from the Church; but they would not go out, if they were of us.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:565
verses.text: Therefore, before they went out they were not of us.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:566
verses.text: If before they went out they were not of us, many are within, are not gone out, but yet are antichrists.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:567
verses.text: We dare to say this: and why, but that each one while he is within may not be an antichrist? For he is about to describe and mark the antichrists, and we shall see them now.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:568
verses.text: And each person ought to question his own conscience, whether he be an antichrist.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:569
verses.text: For antichrist in our tongue means, contrary to  Christ.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:570
verses.text: Not, as some take it, that antichrist is to be so called because he is to come ante Christum, before Christ, i-e: Christ to come after him: it does not mean this, neither is it thus written, but Antichristus, i-e: contrary to Christ.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:571
verses.text: Now who is contrary to Christ ye already perceive from the apostle's own exposition, and understand that none can go out but antichrists; whereas those who are not contrary to Christ, can in no wise go out.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:572
verses.text: For he that is not contrary to Christ holds fast in His body, and is counted therewith as a member.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:573
verses.text: The members are never contrary one to another.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:574
verses.text: The entire body consists of all the members.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:575
verses.text: And what saith the apostle concerning the agreement of the members? "If one member suffer, all the members suffer with it; and if one member be glorified, all the members rejoice with it".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:576
verses.text: If then in the glorifying of a member the other members rejoice with it, and in its suffering all the members suffer, the agreement of the members hath no antichrist.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:577
verses.text: And there are those who inwardly are in such sort in the body of our Lord Jesus Christâ€”seeing His body is yet under cure, and the soundness will not be perfect save in the resurrection of the deadâ€”are in such wise in the body of Christ, as bad humors.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:578
verses.text: When these are vomited up, the body is relieved: so too when bad men go out, then the Church is relieved.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:579
verses.text: And one says, when the body vomits and casts them out, These humors went out of me, but they were not of me.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:580
verses.text: How were not of me? Were not cut out of my flesh, but oppressed my breast while they were in me.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:582
verses.text: "They went out from us; but," be not sad, "they were not of us".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:583
verses.text: How provest thou this? If they had been of us, they would doubtless have continued with us.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:584
verses.text: Hence therefore ye may see, that many who are not of us, receive with us the Sacraments, receive with us baptism.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:585
verses.text: receive with us what the faithful know they receive, Benediction, the Eucharist, and whatever there is in Holy Sacraments: the communion of the very altar they receive with us, and are not of us.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:586
verses.text: Temptation proves that they are not of us.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:587
verses.text: When temptation comes to them as if blown by a wind they fly abroad; because they were not grain.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:588
verses.text: But all of them will fly abroad, as we must often tell you, when once the fanning of the Lord's threshing-floor shall begin in the day of judgment.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:589
verses.text: "They went out from us, but they were not of us; if they had been of us, they would no doubt have continued with us".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:590
verses.text: For would ye know, beloved, how most certain this saying is, that they who haply have gone out and return, are not antichrists, are not contrary to Christ? Whoso are not antichrists, it cannot be that they should continue without.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:591
verses.text: But of his own will is each either an antichrist or in Christ.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:592
verses.text: Either we are among the members, or among the bad humors.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:593
verses.text: He that changeth himself for the better, is in the body, a member: but he that continues in his badness, is a bad humor; and when he is gone out, then they who were oppressed will be relieved.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:594
verses.text: "They went out from us, but they were not of us; for if they had been of us, they would no doubt have continued with us: but (they went out), that they might be made manifest that they were not all of us".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:595
verses.text: That he has added, "that they might be made manifest," is, because even when they are within they are not of us; yet they are not manifest, but by going out are made manifest.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:596
verses.text: "And ye have an unction from the Holy One, that ye may be manifest to your own selves".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:597
verses.text: The spiritual unction is the Holy Spirit Himself, of which  the Sacrament is in the visible unction.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:598
verses.text: Of this unction of Christ he saith, that all who have it know the bad and the good; and they need not to be taught, because the unction itself teacheth them.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:600
verses.text: "I write unto you not because ye know not the truth, but because ye know it, and that no lie is of the truth".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:601
verses.text: Behold, we are admonished how we may know antichrist.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:602
verses.text: What is Christ? Truth.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:603
verses.text: Himself hath said "I am the Truth".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:604
verses.text: But "no lie is of the truth".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:605
verses.text: Consequently, all who lie are not yet of Christ.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:606
verses.text: He hath not said that some lie is of the truth, and some lie not of the truth.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:607
verses.text: Mark the sentence.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:608
verses.text: Do not fondle yourselves, do not flatter yourselves, do not deceive yourselves, do not cheat yourselves: "No lie is of the truth".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:609
verses.text: Let us see then how antichrists lie, because there is more than one kind of lying.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:610
verses.text: "Who is a liar, but he that denieth that Jesus is the Christ?" One is the meaning of the word "Jesus," another the meaning of the word "Christ:" though it be one Jesus Christ our Saviour, yet "Jesus" is His proper name.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:611
verses.text: Just as Moses was so called by his proper name, as Elias, as Abraham: so as His proper name our Lord hath the name "Jesus:" but "Christ" is the name of His sacred character.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:612
verses.text: As when we say, Prophet, as when we say, Priest; so by the name Christ we are given to understand the Anointed, in whom should be the redemption of the whole people.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:613
verses.text: The coming of this Christ was hoped for by the people of the Jews: and because He came in lowliness, He was not acknowledged; because the stone was small, they stumbled at it and were broken.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:614
verses.text: But "the stone grew, and became a great mountain;" and what saith the Scripture? "Whosoever shall stumble at this stone shall be broken; and on whomsoever this stone shall come, it will grind him to powder".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:615
verses.text: We must mark the difference of the words: it saith, he that stumbleth shall be broken; but he on whom it shall come, shall be ground to powder.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:616
verses.text: At the first, because He came lowly, men stumbled at Him: because He shall come lofty to judgment, on whomsoever He shall come, He will grind him to powder.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:617
verses.text: But not that man will He grind to powder at His future coming, whom He broke not when He came.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:618
verses.text: He that stumbled not at the lowly, shall not dread the lofty.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:619
verses.text: Briefly ye have heard it, brethren: he that stumbled not at the lowly, shall not dread the lofty.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:620
verses.text: For to all bad men is Christ a stone of stumbling; whatever Christ saith is bitter to them.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:622
verses.text: For hear and see.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:623
verses.text: Certainly all who go out from the Church, and are cut off from the unity of the Church, are antichrists; let no man doubt it: for the apostle himself hath marked them, "They went out from us, but they were not of us; for if they had been of us, they would no doubt have continued with us".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:624
verses.text: Therefore, whoso continue not with us, but go out from us, it is manifest that they are antichrists.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:625
verses.text: And how are they proved to be antichrists? By lying.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:626
verses.text: "And who is a liar, but he that denieth that Jesus is the Christ?" Let us ask the heretics: where do you find a heretic that denies that Jesus is the Christ? See now, my beloved, a great mystery.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:627
verses.text: Mark what the Lord God may have inspired us withal, and what I would fain work into your minds.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:628
verses.text: Behold, they went out from us, and turned Donatists: we ask them whether Jesus be the Christ; they instantly confess that Jesus is the Christ.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:629
verses.text: If then that person is an antichrist, who denies that Jesus is the Christ, neither can they call us antichrists, nor we them; therefore, neither they went out from us, nor we from them.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:630
verses.text: If then we have not gone out one from another, we are in unity: if we be in unity, what means it that there are two altars in this city? what, that there are divided houses, divided marriages? that there is a common bed, and a divided Christ? He admonishes us, he would have us confess what is the truth:â€”either they went out from us, or we from them.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:631
verses.text: But let it not be imagined that we have gone out from them.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:632
verses.text: For we have the testament of the Lord's inheritance, we recite it, and there we find, "I will give Thee the nations for Thine inheritance, and for Thy possessions the ends of the earth".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:633
verses.text: We hold fast Christ's inheritance; they hold it not, for they do not communicate with the whole earth, do not communicate with the universal body redeemed by the blood of the Lord.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:634
verses.text: We have the Lord Himself rising from the dead, who presented Himself to be felt by the hands of the doubting disciples: and while they yet doubted, He said to them, "It behoved Christ to suffer, and to rise from the dead the third day: and that repentance and remission of sins should be preached in His name"â€”Where? which way? to what persons?â€”"through all nations, beginning at Jerusalem".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:635
verses.text: Our minds are set at rest concerning the unity of the inheritance! Whoso does not communicate with this inheritance, is gone out.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:637
verses.text: But let us not be made sad: "They  went out from us, but they were not of us; for if they had been of us, they would no doubt have continued with us".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:638
verses.text: If then they went out from us, they are antichrists; if they are antichrists, they are liars; if they are liars, they deny that Jesus is the Christ.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:639
verses.text: Once more we come back to the difficulty of the question.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:640
verses.text: Ask them one by one; they confess that Jesus is the Christ.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:641
verses.text: The difficulty that hampers us comes of our taking what is said in the Epistle in too narrow a sense.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:642
verses.text: At any rate ye see the question; this question puts both us and them to a stand, if it be not understood.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:643
verses.text: Either we are antichrists, or they are antichrists; they call us antichrists, and say that we went out from them; we say the like of them.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:644
verses.text: But now this epistle has marked out the antichrists by this cognizance: "Whosoever denies that Jesus is the Christ," that same "is an antichrist".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:645
verses.text: Now therefore let us enquire who denies; and let us mark not the tongue, but the deeds.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:646
verses.text: For if all be asked, all with one mouth confess that Jesus is the Christ.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:647
verses.text: Let the tongue keep still for a little while, ask the life.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:648
verses.text: If we shall find this, if the Scripture itself shall tell us that denial is a thing done not only with the tongue, but also with the deeds, then assuredly we find many antichrists, who with the mouth profess Christ, and in their manners dissent from Christ.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:649
verses.text: Where find we this in Scripture? Hear Paul the Apostle; speaking of such, he saith, "For they confess that they know God, but in their deeds deny Him".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:650
verses.text: We find these also to be antichrists: whosoever in his deeds denies Christ, is an antichrist.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:651
verses.text: I listen not to what he says, but I look what life he leads.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:652
verses.text: Works speak, and do we require words? For where is the bad man that does not wish to talk well? But what saith the Lord to such? "Ye hypocrites, how can ye speak good things, while ye are evil?" Your voices ye bring into mine ears: I look into your thoughts.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:653
verses.text: I see an evil will there, and ye make a show of false fruits.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:654
verses.text: I know what I must gather, and whence; I do not "gather figs of thistles," I do not gather "grapes of thorns;" for "every tree is known by its fruit".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:655
verses.text: A more lying antichrist is he who with his mouth professes that Jesus is the Christ, and with his deeds denies Him.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:656
verses.text: A liar in this, that he speaks one thing, and does another.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:658
verses.text: Now therefore, brethren, if deeds are to be questioned, not only do we find many antichrists gone out; but many not yet maninfest, who have not gone out at all.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:659
verses.text: For as many as the Church hath within it that are perjured, defrauders, addicted to black arts, consulters of fortune-tellers, adulterers, drunkards, usurers, boy-stealers, and all the other vices that we are not able to enumerate; these things are contrary to the doctrine of Christ, are contrary to the word of God.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:660
verses.text: Now the Word of God is Christ: whatever is contrary to the Word of God is in Antichrist.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:661
verses.text: For Antichrist means, "contrary to Christ".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:662
verses.text: And would ye know how openly these resist Christ? Sometimes it happens that they do some evil, and one begins to reprove them; because they dare not blaspheme Christ, they blaspheme His ministers by whom they are reproved: but if thou show them that thou speakest Christ's words, not thine own, they endeavor all they can to convict thee of speaking thine own words, not Christ's: if however it is manifest that thou speakest Christ's words, they go even against Christ, they begin to find fault with Christ: "How," say they, "and why did He make us such as we are?" Do not persons say this every day, when they are convicted of their deeds? Perverted by a depraved will, they accuse their Maker.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:663
verses.text: Their Maker cries to them from heaven, (for the same made us, who new-made us:) What made I thee? I made man, not avarice; I made man, not robbery; I made man, not adultery.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:664
verses.text: Thou hast heard that my works praise me.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:665
verses.text: Out of the mouth of the Three Children, it was the hymn itself that kept them from the fires".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:666
verses.text: The works of the Lord praise the Lord, the heaven, the earth, the sea, praise Him; praise Him all things that are in the heaven, praise Him angels, praise Him stars, praise Him lights, praise Him whatever swims, whatever flies, whatever walks, whatever creeps; all these praise the Lord.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:667
verses.text: Hast thou heard there that avarice praises the Lord? Hast thou heard that drunkenness praises the Lord? That luxury praises, that frivolity praises Him? Whatever thou hearest not in that hymn give praise to the Lord, the Lord made not that thing.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:668
verses.text: Correct what thou hast made, that what God made in thee may be saved.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:669
verses.text: But if thou wilt not, and lovest and embracest thy sins, thou art contrary to Christ.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:670
verses.text: Be thou within, be thou without, thou art an antichrist; be thou within, be thou without, thou art chaff.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:671
verses.text: But why art thou not without? Because thou hast not fallen in with a wind to carry thee away.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:673
verses.text: These things are now manifest, my brethren.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:674
verses.text: Let no man say, I do not worship  Christ, but I worship God His Father.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:675
verses.text: "Every one that denieth the Son, hath neither the Son nor the Father; and he that confesseth the Son, hath both the Son and the Father".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:676
verses.text: He speaks to you that are grain: and let those who were chaff, hear, and become grain.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:677
verses.text: Let each one, looking well to his own conscience, if he be a lover of the world, be changed; let him become a lover of Christ, that he be not an antichrist.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:678
verses.text: If one shall tell him that he is an antichrist, he is wroth, he thinks it a wrong done to him; perchance, if he is told by him that strives with him that he is an antichrist, he threatens an action at law.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:679
verses.text: Christ saith to him, Be patient; if thou hast been falsely spoken of, rejoice with me, because I also am falsely spoken of by the antichrists: but if thou art truly spoken of, come to an understanding with thine own conscience; and if thou fear to be called this, fear more to be it.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:681
verses.text: "Let that therefore abide in you, which ye have heard from the beginning.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:682
verses.text: If that which ye have heard from the beginning shall abide in you, ye also shall abide in the Son, and in the Father.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:683
verses.text: And this is the promise that He hath promised us".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:684
verses.text: For haply thou mightest ask about the wages, and say, Behold, "that which I have heard from the beginning I keep safe in me, I comply therewith; perils, labors, temptations, for the sake of this continuance, I bear up against them all: with what fruit? what wages? what will He hereafter give me, since in this world I see that I labor among temptations? I see not here that there is any rest: mere mortality weigheth down the soul, and the corruptible body presseth it down to lower things: but I bear all things, that "that which I have heard from the beginning" may "remain" in me; and that I may say to my God, "Because of the words of Thy lips have I kept hard ways".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:685
verses.text: Unto what wages then? Hear, and faint not.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:686
verses.text: If thou wast fainting in the labors, upon the promised wages be strong.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:687
verses.text: Where is the man that shall work in a vineyard, and shall let slip out of his heart the reward he is to receive? Suppose him to have forgotten, his hands fail.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:688
verses.text: The remembrance of the promised wages makes him persevering in the work: and yet he that promised it is a man who can deceive thine expectation.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:689
verses.text: How much more strong oughtest thou to be in God's field, when He that promised is the Truth, Who can neither have any successor, nor die, nor deceive him to whom the promise was made! And what is the promise? Let us see what He hath promised.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:690
verses.text: Is it gold which men here love much, or silver? Or possessions, for which men lavish gold, however much they love gold? Or pleasant lands, spacious houses, many slaves, numerous beasts? Not these are the wages, so to say, for which he exhorts us to endure in labor.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:691
verses.text: What are these wages called? "eternal life".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:692
verses.text: Ye have heard, and in your joy ye have cried out: love that which ye have heard, and ye are delivered from your labors into the rest of eternal life.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:693
verses.text: Lo, this is what God promises; "eternal life".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:694
verses.text: Lo, this what God threatens; eternal fire.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:695
verses.text: What to those set on the right hand? "Come, ye blessed of my Father, receive the kingdom prepared for you from the beginning of the world".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:696
verses.text: To those on the left, what? "Go into eternal fire, prepared for the devil and his angels".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:697
verses.text: Thou dost not yet love that: at least fear this.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:699
verses.text: Remember then, my brethren, that Christ hath promised us eternal life: "This," saith he, "is the promise which He hath promised us, even eternal life.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:700
verses.text: These things have I written to you concerning them which seduce you".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:701
verses.text: Let none seduce you unto death: desire the promise of eternal life.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:702
verses.text: What can the world promise? Let it promise what you will, it makes the promise perchance to one that tomorrow shall die.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:703
verses.text: And with what face wilt thou go hence to Him that abideth for ever? "But a powerful man threatens me, so that I must do some evil".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:704
verses.text: What does he threaten? Prisons, chains, fires, torments, wild beasts: aye, but not eternal fire? Dread that which One Almighty threatens; love that which One Almighty promises; and all the world becomes vile in our regard, whether it promise or terrify.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:705
verses.text: "These things have I written unto you concerning them which seduce you; that ye may know that ye have an unction, and the unction which we have received from Him may abide in you".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:706
verses.text: In the unction we have the sacramental sign [of a thing unseen], the virtue itself is invisible; the invisible unction  is the Holy Ghost; the invisible unction is that charity, which, in whomsoever it be, shall be as a root to him: however burning the sun, he cannot wither.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:707
verses.text: All that is rooted is nourished by the sun's warmth, not withered.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:709
verses.text: "And ye have no need that any man teach you, because His unction teacheth you concerning all things".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:710
verses.text: Then to what purpose is it that "we," my brethren, teach you? If "His unction teacheth you concerning all things," it seems we labor without a cause.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:711
verses.text: And what mean we, to cry out as we do? Let us leave you to His unction, and let His unction teach you.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:712
verses.text: But this is putting the question only to myself: I put it also to that same apostle: let him deign to hear a babe that asks of him: to John himself I say, Had those the unction to whom thou wast speaking? Thou hast said, "His unction teacheth you concerning all things".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:713
verses.text: To what purpose hast thou written an Epistle like this? what teaching didst "thou" give them? what instruction? what edification? See here now, brethren, see a mighty mystery.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:714
verses.text: The sound of our words strikes the ears, the Master is within.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:715
verses.text: Do not suppose that any man learns ought from man.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:716
verses.text: We can admonish by the sound of our voice; if there be not One within that shall teach, vain is the noise we make.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:717
verses.text: Aye, brethren, have ye a mind to know it? Have ye not all heard this present discourse? and yet how many will go from this place untaught! I, for my part, have spoken to all; but they to whom that Unction within speaketh not, they whom the Holy Ghost within teacheth not, those go back untaught.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:718
verses.text: The teachings of the master from without are a sort of aids and admonitions.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:719
verses.text: He that teacheth the hearts, hath His chair in heaven.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:720
verses.text: Therefore saith He also Himself in the Gospel: "Call no man your master upon earth; One is your Master, even Christ".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:721
verses.text: Let Him therefore Himself speak to you within, when not one of mankind is there: for though there be some one at thy side, there is none in thine heart.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:722
verses.text: Yet let there not be none in thine heart: let Christ be in thine heart: let His unction be in the heart, lest it be a heart thirsting in the wilderness, and having no fountains to be watered withal.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:723
verses.text: There is then, I say, a Master within that teacheth: Christ teacheth; His inspiration teacheth.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:724
verses.text: Where His inspiration and His unction is not, in vain do words make a noise from without.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:725
verses.text: So are the words, brethren, which we speak from without, as is the husbandman to the tree: from without he worketh, applieth water and diligence of culture; let him from without apply what he will, does he form the apples? does he clothe the nakedness of the wood with a shady covering of leaves? does he do any thing like this from within? But whose doing is this? Hear the husbandman, the apostle: both see what we are, and hear the Master within: "I have planted, Apollos hath watered; but God gave the increase: neither he that planteth is any thing, neither he that watereth, but He that giveth the increase, even God".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:726
verses.text: This then we say to you: whether we plant, or whether we water, by speaking we are not any thing; but He that giveth the increase, even God: that is, "His unction which teacheth you concerning all things".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:727
verses.text: Homily IV.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:728
verses.text: 1 John II.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:729
verses.text: 27â€“III.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:730
verses.text: 8  "And it is true, and lieth not.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:731
verses.text: Even as it hath taught you, abide in it.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:732
verses.text: And now, little children, abide in Him; that, when He shall appear, we may have confidence, and not be put to shame by Him at His coming.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:733
verses.text: If ye know that He is righteous, know ye that every one that doeth righteousness is born of Him.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:734
verses.text: Behold, what manner of love the Father hath bestowed upon us, that we should be called and should be the sons of God:  therefore the world knoweth us not, because it knew not Him, us also the world knoweth not.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:735
verses.text: Beloved, now are we the sons of God, and it is not yet manifested what we shall be.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:736
verses.text: We know that, when He shall appear, we shall be like Him; for we shall see Him as He is.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:737
verses.text: And every man that hath this hope in Him purifieth himself, even as He is pure.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:738
verses.text: Whosoever committeth sin committeth also iniquity.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:739
verses.text: Sin is iniquity.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:740
verses.text: And ye know that He was manifested to take away sin; and in Him is no sin.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:741
verses.text: Whosoever abideth in Him sinneth not: whosoever sinneth hath not seen Him, neither known Him.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:742
verses.text: Little children, let no man seduce you.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:743
verses.text: He that doeth righteousness is righteous, even as He is righteous.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:744
verses.text: He that committeth sin is of the devil; for the devil sinneth from the beginning.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:745
verses.text: For this purpose the Son of God was manifested; that He might destroy the works of the devil".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:747
verses.text: Ye remember, brethren, that yesterday's lesson was brought to a close at this point, that "ye have no need that any man teach you, but the unction itself teacheth you concerning all things".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:748
verses.text: Now this, as I am sure ye remember, we so expounded to you, that we who from without speak to your ears, are as workmen applying culture from without to a tree, but we cannot give the increase nor form the fruits: but only He that created and redeemed and called you, He, dwelling in you by faith and the Spirit, must speak to you within, else vain is all our noise of words.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:749
verses.text: Whence does this appear? From this: that while many hear, not all are persuaded of that which is said, but only they to whom God speaks within.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:750
verses.text: Now they to whom He speaks within, are those who give place to Him: and those give place to God, who "give not place to the devil".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:751
verses.text: For the devil wishes to inhabit the hearts of men, and speak there the things which are able to seduce.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:752
verses.text: But what saith the Lord Jesus? "The prince of this world is cast out".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:753
verses.text: Whence cast? out of heaven and earth? out of the fabric of the world? Nay, but out of the hearts of the believing.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:754
verses.text: The invader being cast out, let the Redeemer dwell within: because the same redeemed, who created.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:755
verses.text: And the devil now assaults from without, not conquers Him that hath possession within.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:756
verses.text: And he assaults from without, by casting in various temptations: but that person consents not thereto, to whom God speaks within, and the unction of which ye have heard.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:758
verses.text: "And it is true," namely, this same unction; i-e: the very Spirit of the Lord which teacheth men, cannot lie: "and is not false.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:759
verses.text: Even as it hath taught you, abide ye in the same.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:760
verses.text: And now, little children, abide ye in Him, that when He shall be manifested, we may have boldness in His sight, that we be not put to shame by Him at His coming".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:761
verses.text: Ye see, brethren: we believe on Jesus whom we have not seen: they announced Him, that saw, that handled, that heard the word out of His own mouth; and that they might persuade all mankind of the truth thereof, they were sent by Him, not dared to go of themselves.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:762
verses.text: And whither were they sent? Ye heard while the Gospel was read, "Go, preach the Gospel to the whole creation which is under heaven".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:763
verses.text: Consequently, the disciples were sent "every where:" with signs and wonders to attest that what they spake, they had seen.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:764
verses.text: And we believe on Him whom we have not seen, and we look for Him to come.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:765
verses.text: Whoso look for Him by faith, shall rejoice when He cometh: those who are without faith, when that which now they see not is come, shall be ashamed.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:766
verses.text: And that confusion of face shall not be for a single day and so pass away, in such sort as those are wont to be confounded, who are found out in some fault, and are scoffed at by their fellowmen.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:767
verses.text: That confusion shall carry them that are confounded to the left hand, that to them it may be said, "Go into everlasting fire, prepared for the devil and his angels".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:768
verses.text: Let us abide then in His words, that we be not confounded when He cometh.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:769
verses.text: For Himself saith in the Gospel to them that had believed on Him: "If ye shall abide in my word, then are ye verily my disciples".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:770
verses.text: And, as if they had asked, With what fruit? "And," saith He, "ye shall know the truth, and the truth shall make you free".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:771
verses.text: For as yet our salvation is in hope, not in deed: for we do not already possess that which is promised, but we hope for it to come.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:772
verses.text: And "faithful is He that promised;" He deceiveth not thee: only do thou not faint, but wait for the promise.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:773
verses.text: For He, the Truth, cannot deceive.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:774
verses.text: Be not thou a liar, to profess one thing and do another; keep thou the faith, and He keeps His promise.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:775
verses.text: But if thou keep not the faith, thine own self, not He that promised, hath defrauded thee.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:777
verses.text: "If ye know that He is righteous, know ye that every one that doeth righteousness is born of Him".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:778
verses.text: The righteousness which at present is ours is of faith.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:779
verses.text: Perfect righteousness is not, save only in the angels: and scarce in angels, if they be compared with God: yet if there be any perfect righteousness of souls and spirits which God hath created, it is in the angels, holy, just, good, by no lapse turned aside, by no pride falling, but remaining ever in the contemplation of the Word of God, and having nothing else sweet unto them save Him by whom they were created; in them is perfect righteousness: but in us it has begun to be, of faith, by the Spirit.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:780
verses.text: Ye heard when the Psalm was read, "Begin ye to the Lord in confession".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:781
verses.text: "Begin," saith it; the beginning of our righteousness is the confession of sins.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:782
verses.text: Thou hast begun not to defend thy sin; now hast thou made a beginning of righteousness: but it shall be perfected in thee when to do nothing else shall delight thee, when "death shall be swallowed up in victory," when there shall be no itching of lust, when there shall be no struggling with flesh and blood, when there shall be the palm of victory, the triumph over the enemy; then shall there be perfect righteousness.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:783
verses.text: At present we are still fighting: if we fight we are in the lists; we smite and are smitten; but who shall conquer, remains to be seen.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:784
verses.text: And that man conquers, who even when he smites presumes not on his own strength, but relies upon God that cheers him on.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:785
verses.text: The devil is alone when he fights against us.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:786
verses.text: If we are with God, we overcome the devil: for if thou fight alone with the devil, thou wilt be overcome.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:787
verses.text: He is a skillful enemy: how may palms has he won! Consider to what he has cast us down! That we are born mortal, comes of this, that he in the first place cast down from Paradise our very original.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:788
verses.text: What then is to be done, seeing he is so well practised? Let the Almighty be invoked to thine aid against the devices of the devil.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:789
verses.text: Let Him dwell in thee, who cannot be overcome, and thou shalt securely overcome him who is wont to overcome.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:790
verses.text: But to overcome whom? Those in whom God dwelleth not.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:791
verses.text: For, that ye may know it, brethren; Adam being in Paradise despised the commandment of God, and lifted up the neck, as if he desired to be his own master, and were loath to be subject to the will of God: so he fell from that immortality, from that blessedness.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:792
verses.text: But there was a certain man, a man now well skilled, though a mortal born, who even as he sat on the dunghill, putrifying with worms, overcame the devil: yea, Adam himself then overcame: even he, in Job; because Job was of his race.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:793
verses.text: So then, Adam, overcome in Paradise, overcame on the dunghill.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:794
verses.text: Being in Paradise, he gave ear to the persuasion of the woman which the devil had put into her: but being on the dunghill he said to Eve, "Thou hast spoken as one of the foolish women".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:795
verses.text: There he lent an ear, here he gave an answer: when he was glad, he listened, when he was scourged, he overcame.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:796
verses.text: Therefore, see what follows, my brethren, in the Epistle: because this is what it would have us lay to heart, that we may overcome the devil indeed, but not of ourselves.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:797
verses.text: "If ye know that He is righteous," saith it, "know ye that every one that doeth righteousness is born of Him:" of God, of Christ.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:798
verses.text: And in that he hath said, "Is born of Him," he cheers us on.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:799
verses.text: Already therefore, in that we are born of Him, we are perfect.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:801
verses.text: Hear.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:802
verses.text: "Behold what manner of love the Father hath given us, that we should be called sons of God, and be (such)".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:803
verses.text: For whoso are called sons, and are not sons, what profiteth them the name where the thing is not? How many are called physicians, who know not how to heal! how many are called watchers, who sleep all night long! So, many are called Christians, and yet in deeds are not found such; because they are not this which they are called, that is, in life, in manners, in faith, in hope, in charity.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:804
verses.text: But what have ye heard here, brethren? "Behold, what manner of love the Father hath bestowed upon us, that we should be called, and should be, the sons of God: therefore the world knoweth us not, because it hath not known Him, us also the world knoweth not".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:805
verses.text: There is a whole world Christian, and a whole world ungodly; because throughout the whole world there are ungodly, and throughout the whole world there are godly: those know not these.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:806
verses.text: In what sense, think we, do they not know them? They deride them that live good lives.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:807
verses.text: Mark well and  see: for haply there are such also among you.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:808
verses.text: Each one of you who now lives godly, who despises worldly things, who does not choose to go to spectacles, who does not choose to make himself drunken as it were by solemn custom, yea, what is worse, under countenance of holy days to make himself unclean: the man who does not choose to do these things, how is he derided by those who do them! Would he be scoffed at if he were known? But why is he not known? "The world knoweth Him not".

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:809
verses.text: Who is "the world"? Those inhabiters of the world.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:810
verses.text: Just as we say, "a house;" meaning, its inhabitants.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:811
verses.text: These things have been said to you again and again, and we forbear to repeat them to your disgust.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:812
verses.text: By this time, when ye hear the word "world," in a bad signification, ye know that ye must understand it to mean only lovers of the world because through love they inhabit, and by inhabiting have become entitled to the name.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:813
verses.text: Therefore the world hath not known us, because it hath not known Him.

verses.name: Augustine: First Epistle of John 2:814
verses.text: He walked here Himself, the Lord Jesus Christ in the flesh; He was God, He was latent in weakness.
